tutorial.title: Present Value of a Lump Sum (Monthly Compounding)
tutorial.scenario:
Liz anticipates it will cost her $65,000 to buy a house in 18 months. How much should she invest today at an annual interest rate of 15% (with interest compounding monthly) to be able to afford the house in one and a half years?

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the future cash flow (in this case 65000), and then press the FV button.
Enter the periodic interest rate (in this case 15/12), and then press the = button followed by the I/Y button.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 18 months), and then press the N button.
Press the CPT button and then the PV button to solve for the present value of the lump sum.
